techmeme.title: China places some rare earth elements under export restrictions as part of its response to Trump's tariffs and imposes a 34% retaliatory tariff on US goods (Reuters)
Sources: Meta aims to launch Llama 4 later in April after pushing back its release at least twice due to benchmark underperformance in reasoning and math tasks (Kalley Huang/The Information)
Chainalysis: North Korean hackers stole $6B+ in crypto over the past decade and accounted for 60%+ of theft losses in 2024; the regime commands 8,000 hackers (Wall Street Journal)
By embracing Trump, Big Tech risks losing access to Europe, pushing Europe to build its own companies and platforms as Chinese companies try to expand to Europe (Foreign Affairs)
Survey: 35% of US adults say they think AI's impact on the US will be negative over the next 20 years, while 56% of AI experts say AI's impact will be positive (Pew Research Center)
